result.execSummary:
The defendant James C Lorman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  No opiates, even with a prescription, and defendant must notify doctor of opiate addiction.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James C Lorman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Court Reporter:  Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  on 15CF749 & 15CF1432.

State indicated Chapter 950 compliant, no additions or corrections to PSI.
Defense had no additions or corrections to PSI.

State recommends further counseling/therapy, 3 years WPS (18 months IC & 18 months ES) & Probation 3 years.
Defense requests probation, any jail time stayed.  

BTC:  on 15CF749:  withheld sentence - Probation 3 years.
No alcohol or c/s unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent. 
full time employment
Must tell doctor or physician about opoid issue and not allowed to have them for pain medication.
No conditional jail time.
Must comply 100% or be revoked and back to court for sentencing.
If back, not eligible for CIP, but eligible for SAT.
DNA sample
Firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assment on both.

(Same for 15CF1432)

records.descr: Case removed from electronic filing process

records.addlTxt: CASH BOND REVOKED - DEFENDANT TO BE HELD UNTIL PSI COMPLETED.
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Court Reporter: Robin Anderson. Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No PSI filed as of today.  Defense provided letter from DOC.  

Defense indicated they have tried to call DOC but hasn't been able to contact the agent.  

BTC:  TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.  BOND REVOKED, MAY BE REINSTITUTED AFTER PSI COMPLETED.  Sentencing date set for 1-18-17 at 3:00 p.m.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling.
Numerous attempts to have defendant complete psi report have gone ignored.  Defendant had contact with Waukesha P&P, but report was to be done in Racine.  
State requests defendant report immediately to P&P.  
Defendant also to be tested today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from Agent Zbieranek requesting additional time to complete a PSI as he has been unable to contact Mr. Lorman.
Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring
Sentencing hearing on September 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon pl to Ct 2 in 15CF749. The State recommends 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC/18 mos ES - STAYED. 3 yrs prob. In 15CF1432, defendant will pl to Ct 1, balance DRI. The State recommends 1 yr RCJ
P-G in 1432, NC in 749
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Deft is ill and defense asks for COP  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Keith David O'Donnell appearsin court for Attorney Michelle Anderson.  Defendant  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.  Defendant does not appear but contacted the SPD office that due to weather he was unable to catch a ride to Racine.  State recommends BW and BF stayed until next court date.  BTC:  BW and BF stayed until the next court date.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks the Court to reduce the cash bond that has been posted as deft has significant financial obligations with his children. The State objects to modification of bond and puts argument on the record.

BTC: bond modification is denied  Plea hearing scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant James C Lorman in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Status conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, MR. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant James C Lorman in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
he State asks for $1000.00 cash in 15CF749 and $2,500.00 in 15CF1432 with no alc/cs. Defense asks that bond be reinstated in 15CF749.

BTC: In 15CF749, bond may be quashed and bond reinstated
         In 15CF1432, $1,500.00 cash. Same terms and conditions as 15CF749. **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY**  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
